title: Phoenix Sepsis Score
description: International consensus criteria for pediatric sepsis and septic shock diagnosis based on organ dysfunction assessment. Developed by the SCCM Pediatric Sepsis Definition Task Force and published in JAMA 2024. Identifies potentially life-threatening organ dysfunction in children with suspected infection.

parameters.name: age
parameters.description: Patient age in years (must be <18 years, excludes birth hospitalizations and preterm infants <37 weeks postconceptional age)

parameters.name: suspected_infection
parameters.description: Presence of suspected or confirmed infection

parameters.name: respiratory_support
parameters.description: Type of respiratory support being provided

parameters.name: pao2_fio2_ratio
parameters.description: PaO2/FiO2 ratio (if arterial blood gas available)

parameters.name: vasoactive_medications
parameters.description: Number of vasoactive medications being administered

ranges.description: Score does not meet sepsis criteria
ranges.interpretation: Phoenix Sepsis Score <2 points. Does not meet criteria for sepsis. Continue monitoring for clinical deterioration and reassess if condition changes.
Phoenix Sepsis Score ≥2 points with suspected infection. Meets criteria for sepsis indicating potentially life-threatening organ dysfunction. Requires urgent medical evaluation and management.

references: Schlapbach LJ, Watson RS, Sorce LR, Argent AC, Menon K, Hartman ME, et al. International Consensus Criteria for Pediatric Sepsis and Septic Shock. JAMA. 2024 Feb 27;331(8):665-674. doi: 10.1001/jama.2024.0179.

Watson RS, Schlapbach LJ, Sorce LR, Argent AC, Menon K, Hartman ME, et al. Development and Validation of the Phoenix Criteria for Pediatric Sepsis and Septic Shock. JAMA. 2024 Feb 27;331(8):675-686. doi: 10.1001/jama.2024.0196.

SCCM Task Force Develops New Criteria to Identify Pediatric Sepsis. Society of Critical Care Medicine. 2024. Available at: https://www.sccm.org/blog/sccm-task-force-develops-new-criteria-to-identify-pediatric-sepsis
formula: Phoenix Sepsis Score = Respiratory subscore + Cardiovascular subscore + Coagulation subscore + Neurologic subscore. Sepsis defined as score ≥2 with suspected infection. Septic shock defined as sepsis with cardiovascular subscore ≥1.
notes: First data-driven international consensus criteria for pediatric sepsis and septic shock
Applies to children <18 years of age with suspected or confirmed infection
Excludes birth hospitalizations and children with postconceptional age <37 weeks
Not designed as a screening tool but standardizes sepsis criteria for reliable identification
Septic shock diagnosis requires sepsis (Phoenix score ≥2) plus cardiovascular dysfunction (cardiovascular subscore ≥1)
Mortality rates: 7.1% in higher-resource settings, 28.5% in lower-resource settings for children meeting sepsis criteria
Replaces previous SIRS-based criteria which had poor predictive value
Developed using global survey, systematic review, multicenter EHR database, and modified Delphi consensus process
